feed.title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

entry.title: [ezsystems/ezpublish-kernel] Object state limitation has no effect
entry.content:
Object state limitation is a policy you can use in your roles to limit access to content based on specific object state values. Due to a flawed earlier update, these limitations were ineffective in releases made since February 16th 2022. They would grant access to the given content regardless of the object state. Depending on how your frontent is designed, knowing the URL to the content may or may not be required to access it. If you are using object state limitations in your roles, this issue is critical. Please apply the fix as soon as possible.

References

  • https://github.com/ezsystems/ezpublish-kernel/security/advisories/GHSA-5x4f-7xgq-r42x
  • https://developers.ibexa.co/security-advisories/ibexa-sa-2022-004-ineffective-object-state-limitation-and-unauthenticated-fastly-purge
  • https://github.com/ezsystems/ezpublish-kernel/commit/133c33cbcaa330953d6283865153f3dfdc7a2e45
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5x4f-7xgq-r42x

entry.title: [snipe/snipe-it] Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) in snipe/snipe-it
entry.content:
Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) in GitHub repository snipe/snipe-it prior to v.6.2.3.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-5511
  • https://github.com/snipe/snipe-it/commit/6d55d782806c9660e9e65dc5250faacb5d0033ed
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/43206801-9862-48da-b379-e55e341d78bf
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-33vj-r6p6-x4p8

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] ConcreteCMS vulnerable to Stored Cross-site Scripting
entry.content:
Concrete CMS v9.2.1 is affected by Arbitrary File Upload vulnerability via the Thumbnail file upload, which allows Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-44763
  • https://github.com/sromanhu/ConcreteCMS-Arbitrary-file-upload-Thumbnail
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wrp2-6v6j-hfmg

entry.title: [oro/commerce] OroCommerce Cross-site Scripting vulnerability in add note dialog of Shopping List line item
entry.content:
Impact

The JS payload added to the product name may be executed at the storefront when adding a note to the shopping list line item containing a vulnerable product. An attacker should be able to edit a product in the admin area and force a user to add this product to Shopping List and click add a note for it.

References

  • https://github.com/oroinc/orocommerce/security/advisories/GHSA-2jc6-3fhj-8q84
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-35950
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2jc6-3fhj-8q84

entry.title: [drupal/core] Exposure of Resource to Wrong Sphere in Drupal Core
entry.content:
Information Disclosure vulnerability in file module of Drupal Core allows an attacker to gain access to the file metadata of a permanent private file that they do not have access to by guessing the ID of the file. This issue affects: Drupal Core 8.8.x versions prior to 8.8.10; 8.9.x versions prior to 8.9.6; 9.0.x versions prior to 9.0.6.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13670
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2020-011
  • https://github.com/drupal/core/commit/f93a37b713b59f8d24e826bc74378099853eef3d
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mmjr-5q74-p3m4

entry.title: [drupal/core] Incorrect Authorization in Drupal core
entry.content:
The QuickEdit module does not properly check access to fields in some circumstances, which can lead to unintended disclosure of field data. Sites are only affected if the QuickEdit module (which comes with the Standard profile) is installed.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13676
  • https://www.drupal.org/sa-core-2021-009
  • https://github.com/drupal/core/commit/8e8e3d2ddd72471ba886346ecabfb5d98fd27d9b
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qfhg-m6r8-xxpj

entry.title: [intelliants/subrion] Subrion CMS vulnerable to CSRF in blog/delete
entry.content:
Subrion CMS is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery in blog/delete/. This has been patched in version 4.2.1.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-18366
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/issues/477
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/commit/8c08d7b92a4b7b5820a951d53c24844715439b73
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c939-g732-48r8

entry.title: [intelliants/subrion] Subrion CMS vulnerable to CSRF in admin/blocks/add
entry.content:
Subrion CMS 4.0.5 has CSRF in admin/blocks/add/. The attacker can create any block, and can optionally insert XSS via the content parameter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-6068
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210126223835/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97091
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q4h5-g3w8-f9x7

entry.title: [statamic/cms] Statamic framework Incorrect Permission Assignment
entry.content:
Statamic framework before 2.6.0 does not correctly check a session's permissions when the methods from a user's class are called. Problematic methods include reset password, create new account, create new role, etc.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-11422
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5m64-9hq5-5pf2

entry.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS)
entry.content:
concrete5 8.1.0 places incorrect trust in the HTTP Host header during caching, if the administrator did not define a "canonical" URL on installation of concrete5 using the "Advanced Options" settings. Remote attackers can make a GET request with any domain name in the Host header. This is stored and allows for arbitrary domains to be set for certain links displayed to subsequent visitors, potentially an XSS vector.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-7725
  • https://hackerone.com/reports/148300
  • https://packetstormsecurity.com/files/142145/concrete5-8.1.0-Host-Header-Injection.html
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/41885/
  • http://hyp3rlinx.altervista.org/advisories/CONCRETE5-v8.1.0-HOST-HEADER-INJECTION.txt
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210124030008/https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/97649/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2mvg-c6mg-3q63

entry.title: [snipe/snipe-it] Cross-site Scripting in snipe/snipe-it
entry.content:
Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Stored in GitHub repository snipe/snipe-it prior to v6.2.2.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-5452
  • https://github.com/snipe/snipe-it/commit/eea2eabaeef16fc8f3a1d61b19c06e9fc8ed942a
  • https://huntr.dev/bounties/d6ed5ac1-2ad6-45fd-9492-979820bf60c8
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rr5c-69c9-gj9f

entry.title: [tribalsystems/zenario] Zenario CMS Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
A Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Zenario CMS v.9.4.59197 allows a local attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted script to the Page Layout.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-44771
  • https://github.com/sromanhu/ZenarioCMS--Stored-XSS---Page-Layout
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6cxv-27r2-fp3m

entry.title: [tribalsystems/zenario] Zenario CMS Cross-site Scripting vulnerability
entry.content:
A Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Zenario CMS v.9.4.59197 allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted script to the Organizer - Spare alias.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-44770
  • https://github.com/sromanhu/ZenarioCMS--Reflected-XSS---Organizer-Alias/blob/main/README.md
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mr4w-7vm9-cgqx
